definition: to level/to raze to the ground
non-Han people, esp. to the East of China/barbarians/to wipe out/to exterminate/to tear down/to raze
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
surname Ping

sentences.english: She said four six-story buildings on her street had been flattened.
sentences.chinese: 她說在她所在的那條街有四個六層的樓房被夷平。

sentences.english: The prospect of flattening a Pakistani city made Obama pause.
sentences.chinese: 夷平一座巴基斯坦城市的後果讓奧巴馬躊躇了。

sentences.english: Labor turns out devices to level not only mountains but also cities.
sentences.chinese: 工人制造出不僅能削平高山而且能夷平城市的工具。

sentences.english: Scores of thousands of cannons would have blasted their front .
sentences.chinese: 好幾萬門大炮將夷平他們的陣線。

sentences.english: The dating of planation surface is still an intractable problem.
sentences.chinese: 而另一方面，夷平面的定年仍是一個棘手的問題。

sentences.english: Subaerial erosion occurs often with reduction to a peneplain.
sentences.chinese: 陸上侵蝕常夷平成準平原。

sentences.english: Close to 100 nearby homes were levelled or severely damaged.
sentences.chinese: 附近有近100所民房被夷平或是嚴重損毀。

sentences.english: They destroyed the village, and they sent their army to calm the village.
sentences.chinese: 他們摧毀了整個村莊，派遣軍隊將整個村莊夷平。

sentences.english: Taliban fighters surrounded the flattened compound, preventing outsiders from approaching.
sentences.chinese: 塔利班戰士包圍了被夷平的營地，防止外人靠近。

sentences.english: The peninsula existent multiple planation surfaces. this article mainly studies in the planation surfaces in the limestone areas of Liaodong Peninsula.
sentences.chinese: 本文中主要研究遼東半島內的石灰岩地區的夷平面。

fine powder/broken pieces

ruins

to raze to the ground/to demolish

to collapse
